author: Special Correspondent
text:
Periyar University has plans to joins hand with the University of Kelaniya, shortly Sri Lanka, to venture into education and research domains for the benefit of the students of both the institutions, said C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University.

Delivering his presidential address at the daylong international workshop on ‘Scholarly research publications: writing, citations and plagiarism’ brought up by the Department of Library and Information Science of the Periyar University here on Monday, Dr. Swaminathan said that the University of Kelaniya has pioneered a number of new developments in higher education. It was one of the first universities to begin teaching science in Sinhala and the first to restructure the traditional arts faculty into three faculties such as Humanities, Social Sciences, and Commerce and Management.

W.K.M.M.K. Weerasinghe, Professor, Department of Library and Information Science, University of Kelaniya, who was the chief guest, said that the University of Kelaniya and Periyar University will join collectively for getting global ranking.
title: Workshop held
